My works

A selection of some of the finest projects I've been involved with

IKEA

For the world largest furniture retailer quality is not enough, and perfection is required.

During my stay in SignSpain we managed to get homologated with IKEA, thus becoming the only Spanish signage retailer for them.

Our scope of work was maintenance and replacement of the gigantic IKEA wordmarks that decorate their stores, as well as the furnishing of their Planning Studios.

Primark

Due to their constant rapid expansion, Primark had got to a point where their oldest stores were lagging behind in branding.

To be able to fix this, an audit of all existing branding elements per shop was required first of all, and that’s what I was asked to do.

I coordinated the surveying of all the Primark stores in Spain (over 50 of them), as well as produced the corresponding reports with the captured info

Caterpillar

When Finanzauto became the official Caterpillar supplier in Spain, all their branding had to be updated to reflect this privilege.

With over 40 locations required to be surveyed and rebranded, this was a big multiphase project that required the management of multiple teams, as well as the supply of their required machinery to each of them.

The cherry on top of this enterprise was without a doubt the installation of their gigantic billboards.

Nike

Swoosh.

That’s the name of the Nike logo, and those were the elements we had to install.

Far from only being signs, in many cases these elements were configurable electronic devices, so it was especially important deploying teams somewhat technologically savvy to assure a correct fitting.

NTT

The Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corporation, commonly known as NTT, acquired various offices in Spain, and due to their very thorough branding philosophy, they required very complete surveys of each site.

This was followed by an extensive and installation of many (many) elements in multiple phases, which was accomplished to great success.

NTT Data

Part of the NTT Group is NTT Data, which had just acquired another large digital consulting company, Everis, and therefore required rebranding.

While not many offices were required, those that did in Madrid, Zaragoza and Barcelona were especially memorable because of their large external illuminated sign, which required an extensive and convoluted attainment of licenses by their respective local administrations, which I was responsible of overseeing.

MoneyGram

With a major amount of shops all over Spain, and a constant stream of updates to their branding, MoneyGram was a lengthy and continual work through the years.

Very careful consideration and planning due to the very odd circumstances that were at play at times in the different shops, due to the old age, weirdness and positioning of some of their elements.

Maisons du Monde

While Ikea is certainly the largest furniture retailer in the world, Maisons du Monde, the french company, doesn’t lag too far behind.

We were charged with the update to their external signage elements, which required working in various malls over the country as well as in Portugal, with a very thorough authorization process that had to be followed for each of them.

Working with a french client was a good opportunity to practice my French, which unfortunately has been direly damaged by many years without exercising it.
